creditline: Gift of the Committee for the Excavation of Antioch to Princeton University
inscribed:
Curse preceded by a lengthy invocation of magical deities: Kadmilos (1) (associated with the Megaloi Theoi of Samothracian mysteries); Arxieris, Arxierissa [1], Arxieria, Arxianassa [5], Arkhieros [7], who may correspond to names mentioned elsewhere as belonging to the Kabeiroi; Dionysos (6,10), Zeus (2,7,8,10), Poseidon (3,10), Hekate (8), Demeter (5,10) and Persephone (2, 27).  

Many unattested epithets as well as magical words appear here. 

Scholars of hipponyms and the ancient circus will find much new material in the names of the horses at the end of the tablet. 

For transcription and translation, see A. Hollmann, “A Curse Tablet from the Circus at Antioch” in Zeitschrift fur Papyrologie Und Epigraphik 145 (2003) 69-71.

texts.textentryhtml: Excavated by the Princeton-led team at Antioch-on-the-Orontes, present-day Antakya, Turkey, 1931-1939; with the Museum since 1939
texts.remarks: Batch edit for Provenance publication project
